text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Bicommunal peace concert sends message of hope that the youth of Cyprus want to live in a United Cyprus...but irresponsible elements give a different picture.
- Madeleine Albright and British Foreign Secretary Robin Cook discussed the Cyprus issue in Washington yesterday.
- Anti-concert protest erupts into violence. Pop stars Sakis Rouvas and Burak Kut send a message for peace in Cyprus.
- Britain is expected to take on a regulatory role during the upcoming meeting between President Clerides and Turkish Cypriot leader Rauf Denktash.
- 4,000 people attend the concert of peace. Regrettable incidents are caused by nationalists.
- All night clashes in the streets of Nicosia. Dozens of people are rounded up and arrested, while scores are injured.
- The results of the peculiar rapprochement concert of partition: the fury of Greeks and the divergence in views of the political leadership.
